required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Hyalase Hydro-dissection in Treatment of Carpal Tunnel: Randomized Double Blind Controlled Clinical Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Hyalase Hydro-dissection in Treatment of Carpal Tunnel: Randomized Double Blind Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Carpal tunnel syndrome (CTS) is a common peripheral entrapment neuropathy, this study aims to investigate if, and to what extent hydro-dissection hyalase and saline of the median nerve could offer symptoms and clinical improvement

detailed_description.textblock: Carpal tunnel syndrome (CTS) is the most common compression syndrome the upper extremities. Its problem has a high prevalence ranged estimated prevalence of 3.8% in the general population, 3 and 7.8% in the working population. It occurs at any age, especially in individuals in their 40s to 60s, and the male: female ratio is reported to be 3:7. A lot of treatment modalities have been tried to improve the condition, starting from local anesthetic injection, steroid, and up to surgical decompression of the nerves.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Investigate if, and to what extent, hydro-dissection using Hyalase versus saline, under ultrasound guidance, can improve the clinical condition, change in nerve conduction parameters of patients with CTS and delay or avoid the surgical intervention.

primary_outcome.description: visual analog scale of pain value of (0 cm) no pain , and value of (10 cm) worst pain

secondary_outcome.description: change of cross sectional area of the median nerve

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in median nerve conduction parameters
secondary_outcome.description: distal motor latency, sensory nerve conduction velocity,peak sensory latency

arm_group.description: injection of Hyalase + 10 cc saline injection nearby median nerve as hydro-dissection
Injection 10 cc saline injection as a median nerve hydro-dissection

intervention.description: injection of Hyalase + 10 cc saline injection nearby median nerve as hydro-dissection
injection of 10 cc saline injection nearby median nerve as hydro-dissection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients
- complaining of carpal tunnel syndrome of 3 month duration or more
- diagnosed axonal neuropathy using electrodiagnosis , nerve conduction study
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient refusal
- infection at the site of intervention
- local anesthetic allergy

responsible_party.investigator_title: Associate professor of Anesthesia, ICU, and pain
